de.esoco.lib.comm

Class GraylogEndpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractFunction<org.obrel.core.Relatable,de.esoco.lib.comm.Connection>
        • de.esoco.lib.comm.Endpoint
          • de.esoco.lib.comm.GraylogEndpoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.Fluent<de.esoco.lib.comm.Endpoint>, java.util.function.Function<org.obrel.core.Relatable,de.esoco.lib.comm.Connection>, org.obrel.core.FluentRelatable<de.esoco.lib.comm.Endpoint>, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class GraylogEndpoint
extends de.esoco.lib.comm.Endpoint
    An endpoint implementation for sending messages to a Graylog server. A graylog endpoint can be created by providing a URL to the standard factory method Endpoint.at(String). The format of the URL must be like this:

    graylog://host[:port]?protocol

    Where protocol stands for one of the enum constants in GraylogEndpoint.Protocol. For an encrypted connection the scheme graylogs can be used instead.

        sHost - The host name or address
        nPort - The port to connect to
